tuv.seg: Proceedings in civil court cases
Imeachtaí i gcásanna cúirte sibhialta
If your civil court case has not been settled 'out-of-court', it will be set down for trial before a court
Muna bhfuil réiteach faighte ar do chás socrófar dáta don triail ós comhair na cúirte
If the defendant in the case has not admitted he/she is at fault, the trial will take the following format;
Muna bhfuil freagracht glactha ag an gcosantóir sa chás, is mar seo a leanas a bheidh an triail;
• Your barrister will outline to the judge the nature of the case and the injuries you suffered
• Déanfaidh d'abhcóide cur síos don bhreitheamh ar an gcás agus ar an ngortú a d'fhulaing tú
• Medical evidence relating to your injuries may be given by a doctor if appropriate to your case
• Más cuí don chás, is féidir le dochtúir fianaise a chur ar fáil maidir leis an ngortú a d'fhulaing tú
• An engineer may be called to give evidence if necessary
• Más gá is féidir innealtóir a ghlaoch le fianaise a thabhairt
• You are called to give evidence:
• Glaofar ort féin le fianaise a thabhairt:
- This will involve swearing on oath and answering the questions posed to you by your barrister as clearly and concisely as possible
- Beidh ort mionn a thógáil agus ceisteanna a fhreagairt a chuireann d'abhcóide féin chomh soiléar agus chomh beacht agus is féidir leat
You will give evidence relating to how the accident occurred and your injuries
Tabharfaidh tú fianaise maidir le cén chaoi ar tharla an timpiste agus an gortú a bhaint duit
- When your barrister has finished asking you questions, you will be cross-examined by the barrister on the other side
- Nuair atá na ceisteanna ar fad curtha ag d'abhcóide, déanfaidh abhcóide an taobh eile tú a chroscheistiú
The object of cross-examination is to discover the truth so you may be asked questions about inconsistencies in your evidence
Tá sé mar aidhm aige seo teacht ar an bhfírinne agus mar sin cuirfear ceisteanna ort maidir le haon chaoi nach bhfuil do chuid freagraí ag cur lena chéile
You may also be told what the defendant or his/her witnesses say is the true version of events and asked to comment on their evidence
D'fhéadfadh sé go n-inseófaí duit an leagan atá ag an gcosantóir nó a f(h)innéithe den fhírinne agus iarrfar ort do bharúil a thabhairt ar a bhfuil le rá acu
• All the other witnesses on your side give evidence and are cross-examined
• Tabharfaidh na finnéithe eile ar do thaobh fianaise agus déanfar iad a chroscheistiú
• The defendant's witnesses are each called to the witness box and give evidence
• Glaofar ar fhinnéithe an chosantóra le fianaise a thabhairt
Your barrister may cross-examine each one of them
Is féidir le d'abhcóide chuile dhuine acu a chroscheistiú
• When all the witnesses have been called, both barristers may make submissions to the judge
• Nuair atá gach finné glaoite, is féidir leis na habhcóidí áiteamh a chur faoi bhráid an bhreithimh
This may include summarising or emphasising certain evidence or making legal arguments
Is féidir leo achomair a dhéanamh ar an bhfianaise nó pointí de a threisiú nó argóintí dlí a dhéanamh
• The judge will make his/her decision on:
• Déanfaidh an breitheamh cinneadh:
- Whether the defendant is at fault and therefore liable to pay damages to you,
- An bhfuil an cosantóir ciontach agus mar sin freagrach as damáistí a íoc leat,
- The amount of damages to which you are entitled as a result of your injuries and
- Cé mhéid damáistí atá ag dul chugat de bharr an ghortaithe agus
- Who shall pay the costs of the proceedings
- Cé a íocfaidh costais an cháis
Usually, if you have won the case, the judge will order that the defendant pay your legal costs as well as his/her own
Go hiondúil, má d'éirigh leat, déanfaidh an breitheamh cinneadh gur ceart don chosantóir íoc as do chuid costas chomh maith lena c(h)uid féin
If you lose, it is likely you will have to pay the costs of both sides
Muna n-éiríonn leat, is iondúil go mbeidh ortsa íoc as costais an dá thaobh

If the defendant admits that he/she is to blame for your injuries and you are not happy with the amount offered in settlement of damages, then the matter will be sent to a court for judgement on the amount of damages you are entitled to

Má admhaíonn cosantóir go bhfuil sé/sí freagrach as do ghortú agus muna bhfuil tú sásta leis na damáistí a thairscíonn sé/sí mar réiteach, cuirfear an cás ós comhair na cúirte le breith a thabhairt ar na damáistí gur cóir duit a fháil
In this situation, the court does not consider the question of who is to blame
Sa chás seo, ní bhreathnaíonn an chúirt ar ceist na freagrachta
The judge will merely place a value on your case based on an examination of the nature and extent of your injuries and the prognosis for the future
Cuirfidh an breitheamh luach ar do chás bunaithe ar scrúdú ar do ghortú agus tuar leighis don todhchaí
This examination will be conducted by considering the available medical reports and/or hearing medical practitioners' evidence relating to your injuries
Déanfar an scrúdú seo tríd na tuairiscí leighis a mheas agus/nó fianaise a chloisteáil ó dhochtúirí a bhaineann le do ghortú
You will be called as a witness so that you can describe your injuries
Glaofar ort mar fhinné le cur síos a dhéanamh ar an ngortú a bhain duit
When will you receive the award?
Cén uair a gheobhaidh tú na damáistí?
Usually awards as a result of civil cases are paid by the defendant to your solicitor within 6 to 8 weeks
Íocann an cosantóir damáistí go hiondúil le do dhlíodóir taobh istigh de 6-8 seachtain
